title: [NEW] Having issues Patching 6.3? Click Here!
body:
> #***UPDATE Feb 11th:  Qihoo 360 Total Security Issues***
We have found that Qihoo has been causing significant problems with patching 6.3:
* *Causes the patcher to appear for a second, then immediately disappears*
* *Causes the patcher to display a "Unspecified Error" message*
* *Pops up a warning about malware*

>If you are using this Security Software, we strongly recommend temporarily uninstalling the program to see if it resolves your issues.

> You can get further info and more troubleshooting steps in [Son Golin's Post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/TEFbgqWZ-new-having-issues-patching-63-click-here?comment=003f0000).




Hey everyone,

With Lunar New Year celebrations winding down its time to look ahead to Valentines Day!  We've been super excited about it and even created a card to let all of you know how much we care!

http://i.imgur.com/WPfG6UH.jpg

Remember, if you have problems with the patch, we got you.  If these steps don't help, drop us a comment and we'll respond!

----------------------------------------------

> #***Files Scanned reaches over 9000!!!!! Or, 15k, 20k, etc***

The patcher needs to scan already installed files to make sure that none of the files are corrupt.  If it finds one, it replaces it and rescans the files.  This is why it can sometimes get as high as 20k, even though there aren't 20k files in the installation.  

**The best thing to do is let it scan files!**  If you restart the client, it may cause it to scan even more files.   The patcher will eventually stop scanning files, and it will patch normally afterward.

> #***Patcher never pops up, or disappears after you press "LAUNCH"***

This can be caused by corruption with the patcher itself or it failed to properly self-patch. Additionally, it may be due to some issues with the configuration of your computer system's permissions (meaning it can't properly save the files in the correct location). To resolve this, make sure to complete all the steps in our [Patching Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues)!

> #***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. Many of the most common Anti-virus programs [have already whitelisted LoL](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3), however make sure to update yours to the latest version!

Also, even though you may have set specific exceptions in place before for your security program, League of Legends has gone through a major update. Therefore, your security program may recognize the old version of League of Legends, but not the new version. 

To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

--------------------------------------------------------------

*If after completing these steps, and you still do not see the glorious orange 'LAUNCH' button, feel free to drop us a post in this thread!  Rioters as well as Wrenchmen volunteers will be on hand to respond and provide some additional help!*

replies.body: my league of legends wont start it just dose that  league of legends icon before it starts and it stops

While this is a usually a common issue during patching, we are seeing a lot more reports than normal.  From investigating this, we actually found that Qihoo 360 Total Security has been [known to cause this specific issue](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/TEFbgqWZ-new-having-issues-patching-63-click-here?comment=003f0000).

If you're using this program, try temporarily uninstalling it to see if you still experience the same issues.  If you are, there may be a different root cause.  In that case, make sure to complete the steps in our [Patching Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues), which has the most common solutions for the patcher simply disappearing.

How about some help that does not revolve around that security app. I don't have that installed on my computer and the client or patcher still will not launch. Like these people have been saying; the logo pops up and then disappears. Help would be appreciated.

delete this folder  C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_launcher in your files. Then relauch it and run it as admin (right-click to do this) . 



If that doesn't work and you have avast i would try to uninstall and run it again.

This worked for me and might be a general solution to the problem. 

Also try step one before and after uninstalling avast. 

Notes:
(They must not have updated the paths for the programs and when updating since i could open the loclient but got maestro error in  C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\0.0.1.186\deploy) and based on research was recently changed in location of this file. The initial lauch i assume is a check to their server so if the client is fine it the transition from the server check but not  to the client launch)

Edit:
Uninstalling avast is most likely not necessary and only would be affect if it put a file needed in your quarantine chest within avast
Thank you very much, this helped.
This worked thank you very much

Thanks! Deleting only the "RADS\projects\lol_launcher" folder worked for me.
FYI, I am on Avast, as well.
me too , can someone answer us?

I tried uninstalling but the newly downloaded version is doing the same thing
Rito is trolling me for having a win streak of 12 games

Whew, glad it's not just me :^)

when i click the launch , the logo shows up , but than disappear, the game did not start at all .     i need help asap!!!!!!
Why do I get a black screen on the launcher even though the launch button works and directs me to the login screen ?

I get on league, get in queue, pick a champ, then my game NEVER pops up, this is the second game in a row and I'm scared I'm going to be banned. I've repatched, ran any virus/malware/registry stuff I have, restarted my computer, ran ad admin, I don't know what to do. My match just never comes up. And I click on the riot icon in the bottom right and I click reconnect and then again, my game never comes up. :(

I've been making a lot of posts about this, but I want to spread the word as much as possible:

Are you running Qihoo 360 Total Security by any chance?  If so, try temporarily uninstalling this program as [this may be causing these issues](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/TEFbgqWZ-new-having-issues-patching-63-click-here?comment=003f0000).

Let me know if you are still experiencing issues!

No, I have Vipre and it hasn't picked up any type of virus, neither has my malware. And I uninstalled it and reinstalled it, took SO LONG, and now I get the launcher, I click launch, and nothing. The Login screen never comes up. I'm so frustrated. :( I'll probably try re-patching it but I'd rather Riot just ditch this patch because I feel like a lot of others are having problems too. I have done EVERYTHING I can think of, and I'm not a computer techie in the slightest. :( I feel so close to giving up.

I entered LoL, I logged in, and i clicked Play. I chose my champion and when it was supposed to appear the cards with our team champions and theyr team chapions nothing happenned. I re-oppenned LoL and I clicked reconnect over and over and over again and in every single time nothing happenne plz help me! I'm lucky i didnt get penalty.
SAME EXACT THING HAPPENED TO ME AND WHEN I UNINSTALLED AND REINSTALLED, THE LOGIN SCREEN NEVER COMES UP. :( ONLY WITH ME IT HAPPENED TWO GAMES IN A ROW!

When i try to update, it keep saying ''unspecified error occurred. pleas check the logs for more information'' i don't know what to do, and i have aleredy tried to reinstall it, and it's didn't fixed it.

Help pleas!

Usually the "Unspecified Error" pop-up means that there is a problem with your computer connecting to our Patching Servers.  Since the patcher has no idea why it can't connect, it pops up this error message.  The best steps you can take to solve this is to complete all of the steps in our [Connection Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).  It has the most common solutions to this error.

If you are still getting this error, regardless of these steps, don't hesitate to reply back and let me know!

after update to 6.3, everything was okay for the first game.I closed the game, and the problem started. When I launch the game, nothing pop out. Instead my virus protector says that it detected a virus. I have tried to uninstall, deleting the game and reinstall the game, the same situation occur. I cannot even update the patch, cannot launch the game, it just pop out the league of legend icon, and nothing runs.{{champion:63}} {{summoner:11}} 
the virus:heur/qvm10.1.malware.gen{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

If you're having the trouble yet, I fixed it by goin to the antivirus (in my case Avast!) virus chest and found that the program had a file from the game on quarantine, so, I just restored the file and that fixed the problem. Hope this helps you.
I love u so much
Same problem here bro. Never had this kind of issue before.
27k files scanned and i do not have 360 total security when will it stop scanning?

Hello. After Patching Successfully and Playing a game, I left my client running for around 3 hours whilst I took a class. When I returned, I attempted to play a game with my friends, but I was disconnected from PVP.net and logged out. I have been trying to re-log for a while now, all the while the client returning 'Unable to connect to PVP.net'. 

I have looked up several steps as to fixing this, all have failed. The Steps I have tried are:

Restarting the Client
Restarting my PC
Disabling IP helper
Flushing DNS
Repairing my Client.

Are there any things I have missed, or anything I could try to fix this problem?{{item:3070}}


EDIT: UPDATE - Tried logging into the NA server on an NA Alt - Worked perfectly. EUW Still broken

There may be some sort of corruption with the patch itself, causing these issues.  The best step you can take is to complete the steps in our [Patching Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues).  They should get this completely resolved and get you back into the client.

Give me a heads up if you are still experiencing issues!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=TEFbgqWZ,comment-id=000f0001,timestamp=2016-02-10T22:51:52.534+0000)
>
> There may be some sort of corruption with the patch itself, causing these issues.  The best step you can take is to complete the steps in our [Patching Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues).  They should get this completely resolved and get you back into the client.
> 
> Give me a heads up if you are still experiencing issues!



Hi Dartagnan. I have followed all the steps listed in the Patching Issues Guide you linked, and I am still receiving the error. To be honest, I don't think the patch itself is an Issue - I'd already played a game on the patch before my connection problems started occurring, and non of the steps presented in 'patching issues' worked. This is the Error Text presented to me when trying to log in:

Connection Error

connection failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server.

information regarding what may have caused this error can be found here (<- This link is broken)

service availability can be viewed on the League of Legends Server Status web page.


Are there any other steps I could follow to fix this?
{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

EDIT: I have also uninstalled several programs such as Raptr, to no avail.

Attempted to log in to a different account on EUW on my machine - didn't work
Attempted to log in to an account on NA on my Machine - worked perfectly.

Clearly this issue is between my machine and EUW's authentication servers, if that helps.

EDIT 2: Tried connecting at University - Worked perfectly. This is definitely an issue with either my machine or my building's Internet.

EDIT 3: Connecting on a different machine seems to have fixed the problem for now - I am once again able to log in.

I keep getting "Unspecified error occurred." and when I try to patch again, it's stuck at 33%. In the past, the fix you described [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2fzqzu/solved_unspecified_error_when_patching/) (deleting lol_air_client) has worked, but so far I've tried this fix **three times**, to no avail. Either I get the "Unspecified error occurred", or the patcher gets stuck at 33%. This is really frustrating, especially considering that attempting this fix takes many hours, only to see the same error every time. I'm considering reinstalling the whole game, but I doubt that it would help. Any advice you can offer would be appreciated.

Also, my internet connection isn't a problem.

Hey Riot,

Rather than tell people to follow your damn guides in order to find a fix (which never work by the way), why don't you actually fix your damn client. The fucking thing has had issues for a long time, and yet you have don nothing to fix/improve it.

I too have been having the same issue as many other players: The patch will get stuck at 33%, and will continue to scan files until the end of time.

No matter how many times I fucking reinstall League, switch my region (which is supposed to work apparently), and repair the game files, the results are consistent.

My Anti-Virus software (McAfee) hasn't gotten in the way at all, and my Internet connection is working properly.

So, instead of siting at your computers, typing the same old fucking replies (which don't even help fix the issue at all), get to work **fixing** the issue, because right now, it seems like you're all dancing around it, avoiding it like the fucking plague.

EDIT - I've been up since 6:00 AM EST, and it's STILL stuck t 33% and scanning seemingly endless files. Seeing as it's 2:14 PM EST right now, I'm about to just quit League until you ***** fix the damn client, which you should have done updates ago.

EDIT - I would also like to point out that my patcher is at 235,000 files and still climbing. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} FIX YOUR GAME!
When I tried to update my client, it popped up: virus "HEUR/QVM10.1.Malware.Gen" detected. Then, I completely uninstalled, downloaded and installed the client. This message showed up again.

My league of legends gets to the launcher where I can see the champion rotation and such, and after I hit 'play', nothing happens. It just sits there. I've literally done everything I can. I've uninstalled, restarted my computer, tried deleting the lol_launcher in the RADS/projects. It still won't work.

My league starts up alright but it stops working after I champ select with an error about 0x and memory. Happened after I installed this update. I updated all my drivers and have the right amount of specs. Please help???

i just uninstalled and reinstalled and the launcher wont even download an update. when i press repair files it doesnt do anything. and then if i press launch the launcher just sits there and doesnt do anything. please help

replies.poster: i m a p o s
replies.body:
I'm running Windows 7 64-bit.

I had the issue of double-clicking the launcher, logo popped up, disappeared, then nothing happened.

To fix this I first checked all my antivirus (I run Avast), to ensure it was not added to the quarantine folder etc...

Then, I uninstalled all updates that were downloaded by Microsoft on the 12th and 13th (as the issue occurred after I closed LoL and turned off the computer on the 12th).

I then searched for the file "LoLPatcher.exe" and double-clicked. It launched and ran perfectly. Problem fixed.

Note: the "LoLPatcherUx.exe" will not work. Don't get them confused. Also, I highly recommend trying the "LoLPatcher.exe" file BEFORE uninstalling updates, as uninstalling them is quite time consuming. If it works without uninstalling the updates, good!

Good luck to all trying to fix their problems! Upvote if this solves your issue so others can benefit!

mine just says "PVP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working"
{{item:3151}}

Sometimes League of Legends can affect 1 person, but judging by the comments..... we're all in the same boat at the moment. well guess you could at least know your not the only one having a problem with league.

******************** PSA ******************

If you are using AVAST, this patch update for some reason put the client launcher into the quarantine chest for AVAST.  All you need to do is remove it from the quarantine chest in the AVAST interface and then add it to the exclusion folder.

KEEP CALM AND RIFT ON!

My league of legends client has been scanning files for 4 days straight. I've tried literally everything. I'm really really close go giving up and quitting. If riot makes all this money and has this many players why cant they make a client that doesn't bug out and have so many problems. I have had 30+ people from my home town quit league cause of problems with the client lol.

Edit------ currently at 106k files scanned.
I think it would be more helpful if Riot just fixed the client, since then half of these issues wouldn't occur anymore.

So basically what happened is that I tried to log in after the new update. After typing in my password, the client made that little clicking noise but didn't bring me into the game. Rather it told me that patch 6.2 (other numbers following those) was rejected by the server.

So, thinking that it was a bug because my wifi crashed mid-update, I uninstalled league. I then went to reinstall. This is now my issue. It won't start up the client. All that happens is that I see the League of Legends mark on my screen but never goes passed that. It just freezes.

I've tried to uninstall, re-install, but the same thing happens every time. I also tried the steps the were posted as the solution, but that didn't work either. In fact, most of the files I was told to deleted weren't even showing up. 

I'm honestly stumped on what I should do.

To dig a little deeper into this, are you running AVG Anti-virus at all?  We have been hearing reports that it may be interacting negatively with League.  If you are, try temporarily uninstalling it to see if the patcher works normally.

Give me a heads up if this seems unrelated at all!

Win8.1

If you are still not able to get past the patcher/Log-in Screen, at this point I strongly recommend [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  By doing so, we can work with you one-on-one until this issue is resolved.  Additionally, make sure to provide the following logs so we can dig a bit deeper:

1) [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)

2) [Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)

3) [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)

After disabling window firewall, continue force repatch.
Still;
<Unspecified Error has occurred.>

No I do no use Qihoo 360 

I have submitted a ticket, see if that helps you.

Thank You
